Initialization method

Source: R/zzz_VI_MODEL.R
HETER_MODEL-cash-..init...Rd

This function will be called after an instance is built. User input will be stored in the environment. The response variable of this model is y. The formula of y is defined in HETER_MODEL$formula, the null formula is defined in HETER_MODEL$null_formula, the formula for sigma is defined in HETER_MODEL$sigma_quote_formula, the formula for e is defined in HETER_MODEL$e_quote_formula.

Arguments

a

Numeric. Default is a = 0.

b

Numeric. Default is b = 1.

x

Random variable or closed form expression. Default is x = rand_uniform(-1, 1, env = new.env(parent = parent.env(self))).

Value

No return value, called for side effects.

Examples


# Instantiation
test <- heter_model(a = 0, b = 20)

test
#> 
#> ── <HETER_MODEL object>
#> y = 1 + x + e
#>  - x: <RAND_UNIFORM object>
#>    [a: -1, b: 1]
#>  - e: <CLOSED_FORM object>
#>    EXPR = RAND_NORMAL[["gen"]](length(sigma), mu = 0, sigma = sigma)
#>     - sigma: <CLOSED_FORM object>
#>       EXPR = sqrt(1 + (2 - abs(a)) * (x - a)^2 * b)
#>        - x: <RAND_UNIFORM object>
#>          [a: -1, b: 1]
#>  - a: 0
#>  - b: 20 

# Generate data
test$gen(10)
#>             y           x    sigma          e
#> 1  -6.6811281 -0.77840631 5.023610 -6.9027218
#> 2   2.4871558  0.59820052 3.913279  0.8889553
#> 3  -2.1778100  0.73386383 4.747867 -3.9116738
#> 4   3.7834426 -0.70615710 4.576714  3.4895997
#> 5   0.7528927 -0.76383594 4.933337  0.5167286
#> 6   0.4608442 -0.04440746 1.038692 -0.4947484
#> 7  -3.0884936 -0.75096491 4.853651 -3.3375287

#> 9   3.1578463  0.58626400 3.840341  1.5715823
#> 10  0.8156644 -0.82572725 5.317238  0.6413916
